metadata.name: Ensure that the Kubernetes PKI certificate file permissions are set to 644 or more restrictive (Manual)
metadata.description: Ensure that Kubernetes PKI certificate files have permissions of 644 or more restrictive.
metadata.rationale:
Kubernetes makes use of a number of certificate files as part of the operation of its components.
The permissions on these files should be set to 644 or more restrictive to protect their integrity.
metadata.audit: Run the below command (based on the file location on your system) on the Control Plane node. For example, ``` ls -laR /etc/kubernetes/pki/*.crt ``` Verify that the permissions are 644 or more restrictive.
metadata.remediation: Run the below command (based on the file location on your system) on the Control Plane node. For example, ``` chmod -R 644 /etc/kubernetes/pki/*.crt ```
metadata.default_value: By default, the certificates used by Kubernetes are set to have permissions of 644
